title: The Ultimate Guide to Using Twitter Bookmarks

steps.title: Open Twitter (X).
steps.content: Open Twitter (X). To do so on a computer, go to https://twitter.com . If you're using an Android, iPhone, or iPad, you can open the X app, which has a black icon with a white "X." This will display your Twitter feed. You need to be logged into Twitter to view or bookmark any tweets. If you are not logged in automatically, log in your username and password. If you do not have a Twitter account, you will need to create one to view Twitter and create bookmarks.

steps.title: Click or tap the Share button on the tweet you want to bookmark .
steps.content: Click or tap the Share button on the tweet you want to bookmark . It's the button that resembles an arrow pointing up over a tray (iPhone & desktop PC) or the three connected dots (Android) at the lower-right corner of the tweet. This displays the Share menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Bookmark.
steps.content: Click or tap Bookmark . It's at the bottom of the Share menu. This adds the tweet to your Bookmarks.

steps.title: Tap your profile image (mobile only).
steps.content: Tap your profile image (mobile only). If you are using the X mobile app, tap your profile icon in the upper-left corner to display the menu. If you are using a tablet or desktop PC, the menu bar is to the left of your feed.

steps.title: Click Bookmarks to view your Bookmarks.
steps.content: Click Bookmarks to view your Bookmarks. It's next to an icon that resembles a bookmark to the left of your Twitter feed, or in the profile menu.

steps.title: Remove a bookmark.
steps.content: Remove a bookmark. To remove a bookmark, click or tap the Share button in the lower-right corner of a tweet on your Bookmarks page, then click Remove from Bookmarks .
